citation.article-title: Proposal of Solimonas aquatica sp. nov., reclassification of Sinobacter flavus Zhou et al. 2008 as Solimonas flava comb. nov. and Singularimonas variicoloris Friedrich and Lipski 2008 as Solimonas variicoloris comb. nov. and emended descriptions of the genus Solimonas and its type species Solimonas soli
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Solimonas Kim et al. 2007
Solimonas (So′li.mo′nas. L. n. solum soil; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Solimonas a monad from soil).
Gram-negative, rod-shaped, aerobic or facultatively anaerobic cells.
Cells of some species are motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C18 : 1ω7c.
The predominant polar lipids include phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and an uncharacterized aminophospholipid.
The main respiratory quinone is Q-8.
The DNA G+C content is 64.9–68.4 mol%.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis indicates that the genus is a member of the Gammaproteobacteria.
The type species is Solimonas soli.
